dag_nodes.label: CPaaS Market Commoditization
dag_nodes.description: Industry-wide competitive pressure and pricing dynamics in WhatsApp/SMS messaging business

dag_nodes.label: Carrier Cost Inflation
dag_nodes.description: Telco carriers increasing wholesale messaging costs, passed through to customers with lag

dag_nodes.label: CPaaS Revenue Growth
dag_nodes.description: Volume expansion in CPaaS segment driving top-line growth despite margin pressure

dag_nodes.label: CPaaS Gross Margin Decline
dag_nodes.description: CPaaS margin compressed from 24% to 12% due to commoditization + carrier costs

dag_nodes.label: Revenue Mix Shift
dag_nodes.description: CPaaS increasing from 66% to 72% of total revenue, SaaS declining from 34% to 28%

dag_nodes.label: Consolidated Gross Margin Compression
dag_nodes.description: Blended gross margin collapsed from 38% to 20% due to unfavorable mix shift

dag_nodes.label: G&A Cost Reduction
dag_nodes.description: 15% workforce reduction and operational streamlining reducing G&A by 25% YoY

dag_nodes.label: EBITDA Generation
dag_nodes.description: LTM normalized EBITDA stable at BRL 88-100MM despite margin pressure

dag_nodes.label: Operating Cash Flow
dag_nodes.description: Cash generation from operations reduced due to margin compression

dag_nodes.label: Liquidity Stress
dag_nodes.description: Negative working capital BRL -444MM, cash declining from BRL 117MM to BRL 33MM

dag_nodes.label: Debt Renegotiation & Covenant Waivers
dag_nodes.description: Extended payment terms and covenant relief obtained but signals fragility

dag_nodes.label: Strategic Pivot to SaaS
dag_nodes.description: Management focus shift to Zenvia Customer Cloud, CPaaS divestiture under evaluation

dag_nodes.label: Zenvia Customer Cloud Adoption
dag_nodes.description: Product traction: 23% YoY growth, 80% usage increase Q2 vs Q1, franchisee channel launched

dag_nodes.label: CPaaS Divestiture (Potential)
dag_nodes.description: Sale of CPaaS business to deleverage balance sheet, estimated BRL 400-500MM proceeds

dag_nodes.label: Shareholder Value
dag_nodes.description: Stock price, market cap, intrinsic value realization

dag_edges.mechanism: Competitive pressure forces pricing concessions, reducing CPaaS unit economics
Carrier cost increases directly compress CPaaS gross margin with pass-through lag
Competitive pricing enables volume growth but at deteriorating margins
CPaaS volume growth increases CPaaS revenue share mechanically
CPaaS margin decline (24%→12%) directly reduces consolidated gross margin
Shift to CPaaS (12% margin) from SaaS (55% margin) mechanically compresses blended margin
Gross margin compression reduces gross profit dollars available for EBITDA
G&A reduction partially offsets margin compression, supporting EBITDA resilience
EBITDA generation drives operating cash flow (excluding working capital changes)
Reduced operating cash flow exacerbates liquidity stress and working capital deficit
Liquidity stress necessitates debt renegotiation and covenant waiver requests
Strategic focus and resource allocation accelerate Zenvia Customer Cloud development and GTM
SaaS adoption at 70% gross margin improves EBITDA as it scales
Liquidity stress creates urgency to divest CPaaS for balance sheet deleveraging
Strategic pivot makes CPaaS divestiture coherent with long-term SaaS-only vision
CPaaS sale proceeds (BRL 400-500MM) would eliminate liquidity stress and debt
EBITDA generation supports valuation multiples and shareholder value
SaaS scaling at high margins drives long-term shareholder value creation
Liquidity stress and going concern risk depresses valuation multiples and stock price
Successful CPaaS divestiture unlocks value through balance sheet repair and strategic clarity

critical_path.description: The critical path to shareholder value runs through successful execution of the strategic pivot: (1) Zenvia Customer Cloud must achieve scale and profitability to offset CPaaS decline, AND (2) CPaaS divestiture must execute at reasonable valuation to resolve liquidity stress. Failure on either dimension results in continued margin compression, cash burn, and dilutive refinancing.
key_risks: SaaS scaling slower than CPaaS margin erosion
CPaaS divestiture fails to execute or achieves low valuation
Liquidity crisis forces distressed equity raise or asset sale
Competitive pressure in both CPaaS and SaaS intensifies

feedback_loops.description: Margin compression → reduced cash flow → liquidity stress → covenant breaches → distraction/uncertainty → harder to execute strategic pivot
feedback_loops.note: Company trapped in negative cycle; CPaaS divestiture is circuit breaker

feedback_loops.description: Strategic focus → SaaS adoption → improved margins/EBITDA → higher valuation → easier capital access → more investment in SaaS
feedback_loops.note: Positive flywheel IF SaaS scales quickly enough
